header.title: Technology Watch Center
header.subtitle: Stay informed about the latest advances in oncology and health technologies

about.title: Technology Watch in Oncology AI
about.subtitle: An analysis of artificial intelligence advances in cancer treatment and diagnosis

projectContext.title: Project Context
projectContext.description: This technology watch focuses on artificial intelligence applications in oncology, a rapidly evolving field that promises to revolutionize cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient care.

earlyDetection.title: Early Detection
earlyDetection.description: AI algorithms for early cancer screening and diagnosis

personalizedTreatment.title: Personalized Treatment
personalizedTreatment.description: Precision medicine tailored to individual patient profiles

acceleratedResearch.title: Accelerated Research
acceleratedResearch.description: Machine learning for drug discovery and clinical trials

team.title: Development Team
team.description: This project was developed by a multidisciplinary team combining technical and medical expertise.

sources.title: Information Sources
items: Scientific Publications: PubMed, Nature, Science journals
Industry Reports: Market research and competitive analysis
Conference Proceedings: ASCO, HIMSS, AI conferences
Patent Databases: USPTO, EPO for innovation tracking
Regulatory Updates: FDA, EMA approval tracking

analysis.title: Analysis Process
items: Automated content aggregation via RSS feeds
Relevance scoring based on predefined criteria
Expert review and validation of key findings

opportunities.title: Market Opportunities
items: Government support for AI in healthcare

multimodal.title: Multimodal AI
multimodal.description: Integration of imaging, genomics, and clinical data for comprehensive patient analysis

foundation.title: Foundation Models
foundation.description: Large language models adapted for medical applications and clinical decision support

explainable.title: Explainable AI
explainable.description: Development of interpretable AI systems for clinical trust and regulatory compliance

edge.title: Edge Computing
edge.description: Deployment of AI models at the point of care for real-time analysis

technical.title: Technical Objectives
items: Develop automated RSS feed aggregation system
Create responsive web interface for content consumption
Design scalable architecture for data processing

professional.title: Professional Development
items: Gain expertise in healthcare technology trends
Build project management and documentation skills

rss.mainSubtitle: Stay informed about the latest advances in oncology and health technologies
rss.title: RSS Feeds
rss.noFeedsSubtitle: Start by adding your first RSS feed to automatically receive articles.
rss.noFeedsForAdmins: Use the field above to add your first RSS feed.
rss.noFeedsForUsers: Contact an administrator to add RSS feeds.

messages.confirmDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this RSS feed? This action is irreversible and will also delete all associated articles.

feed.noArticlesSubtitle: This feed doesn't have articles yet or they haven't been fetched.

content.introduction: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the field of oncology by providing sophisticated tools to improve diagnosis, treatment, and patient monitoring for cancer patients. This emerging technology promises to radically transform oncological care.

diagnosticImaging.title: Diagnostic imaging
diagnosticImaging.description: AI algorithms analyze medical images with remarkable precision, detecting subtle abnormalities that the human eye might miss. This technology significantly improves the early detection of diseases.

personalizedMedicine.title: Personalized medicine
personalizedMedicine.description: AI enables analysis of tumor genomic profiles to propose tailored treatments, thus optimizing therapeutic efficacy while minimizing side effects.

results.title: Promising results
results.description: Clinical studies show significant improvement in survival rates and quality of life for patients through the use of AI in oncology. Algorithms achieve diagnostic precision levels comparable to, or even superior to, those of specialists.

challenges.title: Challenges and perspectives
challenges.description: Despite its potential, implementing AI in oncology faces important challenges: rigorous clinical validation, ethical questions, healthcare professional training, and integration into existing workflows.

standalone.title: Standalone Articles
standalone.noArticlesSubtitle: Start by adding your first standalone article.
